name: Janis Stocks
blurb:
Ms. Stross is a certified Specialist in Family Law and a Fellow in the American Academy of Matrimonial Lawyers.
Ms. Stross specializes in all aspects of family law, including complex issues of property, support, and custody. She has successfully represented corporate executives, venture capitalists, business professionals, and other high net worth individuals throughout the litigation process and in trial.
Northern California Super Lawyers named Ms. Stross a Super Lawyer from 2005 to 2011 and one of the top fifty women lawyers in Northern California in 2007, 2008, 2010, and 2011. Ms. Stross received an AV Peer Review Rating by Lexis Nexis Martindale-Hubbell.  She was selected by her peers for inclusion in The Best Lawyers in America in 2010 and 2011.
legal_orgs: Litigation and Trial

name: Ellen Stross
blurb: I've been handling complex family law cases for approximately 20 years.

name: Lowell Sucherman
blurb: Ronald M. Supancic has practiced Family Law exclusively since 1970.   Ron was admitted to the Supreme Court of the United States on October 15, 1975. He has been certified by the California Bar Association Board of Legal Specialization as a Family Law Specialist since the inception of that certification program in 1980. Ron has handled hundreds of contested dissolutions, child custody cases, and disputed post-marital proceedings. He has served as a Mediator and as a Judge Pro Tem with the Los Angeles County Superior Court since 1976. Ron holds an AV rating with the Martindale Hubbell Law Register. The 'A' signifies the highest level of legal ability, while the 'V' denotes 'very high' adherence to the professional standards of conduct, ethics, reliability and diligence. In addition to having taught Family Law at the University of Southern California School of Law, Ron is a frequent presenter at the California Bar Convention, and various other professional associations. Ron is regularly voted one of L.A.'s Super Lawyers by a jury of his peers, in Los Angeles Magazine. At a special ceremony held this September, Ron was honored by the California State Bar for 30 years of service as a Certified Family Law Specialist.
legal_orgs: Practice emphasizes Collaborative Divorce, Consensual Dispute Resolution, Mediation, Litigation, Child Custody & Support, Property Division, Paternity, Estate Planning, Adoption. Our firm is LGBT friendly.

name: Stephen Wagner
blurb:
Ms. Wallacker is a Certified Specialist in Family Law and a Fellow in the American Academy of Matrimonial Lawyers.

Ms. Wallacker has practiced all aspects of family law since 1993. She has substantial experience litigating and settling complex family law cases that involve custody, support and property.  She also devotes an increasing portion of her practice to Collaborative Practice and mediation, two highly effective forms of alternative dispute resolution.

Ms. Wallacker was named a Northern California Super Lawyer in years 2005-2013 and was also named one of the top fifty women lawyers in Northern California in 2009 and 2010.  Ms. Wallacker received an AV Peer Review Rating by Lexis Nexis Martindale-Hubbell. She has been selected for inclusion in The Best Lawyers of America since 2011.

Ms. Wallacker was previously associated with the law firms of Esther R. Lerner and Schapiro-Thorn, Inc., in San Francisco, California.

Ms. Wallacker is a current member of the San Francisco and San Mateo County Bar Associations, Collaborative Practice San Mateo County and the International Academy of Collaborative Professionals.  She is a current member of the San Mateo County Multi-Option ADR Project (MAP), and Family Law ADR Panel Advisory Committees, and was recently chosen to serve on the Mediation Referral Panel.  Ms. Wallacker has chaired the Family Law Section of the San Mateo County Bar Association and Collaborative Practice San Mateo County. She is a volunteer mediator in Department 19 at the San Mateo County Superior Court.  In addition, Ms. Wallacker was a member of Custody and Property North, sub-committees of the Family Law Section of the California State Bar.

Ms. Wallacker presented a Webinar on Effective Case Management Tips, Tricks, and Techniques for Family Lawyers in October 2010.  She also presented at a 2008 Loco Parentis Luncheon on Work/Life Balance in the Legal Profession and presented at the State Bar Spring 1998 Section Education Institute on Disclosure Duties.

Ms. Wallacker received her law degree from the University of Michigan in 1992, after graduating cum laude from the University of California at Davis with a Bachelor of Arts in Economics in 1988.
legal_orgs: Alternate Dispute Resolution

name: Gretchen Wallacker
blurb: My practice emphasizes traditional client representation and litigation. In addition, I draft premarital, postmarital, and cohabitation agreements. I serve as an expert witness in the legal malpractice actions and in the area of premarital agreements.

name: Peter Walzer
blurb: Since the firm's founding in 1984, the attorneys at Wasser, Cooperman & Carter, P.C. have established a reputation for handling even the most complex and contentious disputes with the utmost discretion. The firm's attorneys understand the sensitive nature of difficult family law matters, and are dedicated to maintaining the privacy of a diverse clientele, including a number of prominent figures in business and the entertainment industry. In recognition of their work, the firm's attorneys have been honored by venerated legal organizations, including SuperLawyers magazine, "Best Lawyers in America", and national directory of attorneys Martindale-Hubbell, which has awarded the firm its AV Preeminent rating, signifying the highest standards of professional excellence. In addition, many attorneys at the firm have been certified as Specialists in Family Law by the California Board of Legal Specialization, indicating that they have demonstrated a high level of experience, proficiency, and commitment in their field of practice.
legal_orgs: With offices in Los Angeles, the law firm Wasser, Cooperman & Carter, P.C. provides clients throughout Southern California with exceptional legal services in all aspects of family law. The firm's areas of expertise include jurisdictional divorce issues; marital property characterization, valuation, and division; spousal and child support; child custody cases; paternity matters; and prenuptial, postnuptial, and marital settlement agreements.
